intro: Coussapoa asperifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved balsa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky slopes. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
